relevant_findings.general: Alert and oriented x3, sitting in bed comfortably in no acute distress.
relevant_findings.HEENT: Sclera anicteric, moist mucous membranes, oropharynx clear.
relevant_findings.neck: Supple, JVP not elevated, no lymphadenopathy.
relevant_findings.lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, no wheezes/rales/rhonchi.
relevant_findings.cardiovascular: Regular rate and rhythm, normal S1/S2, no murmurs/rubs/gallops.
relevant_findings.abdomen: Tenderness to palpation in the periumbilical region and left lower quadrant, but no guarding or peritoneal signs. Abdomen otherwise soft. No costovertebral angle tenderness.
relevant_findings.neurological: Alert and oriented x3, cranial nerves II-XII grossly intact, normal gait.

relevant_findings.abdominal_exam: Continued tenderness in the lower abdomen, but no changes in guarding or peritoneal signs.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient continues to have dark stools, but no longer has bright red blood.
